Studentship SuccessPedagogies of Punishment

Dr Laura Helyer will be undertaking a staff-led doctoral studentship, to conduct research on the morality of school disciplinary practices and policies. She will work with Dr John Tillson (Education Studies) and Dr Lorna Bourke (Psychology), one external and one internal collaborator will provide advisory input Dr Winston C Thompson (philosophy of education, Ohio State University) and Dr Julie Hadwin (Psychology). The supervisory team successfully applied to the Philosophy of Education Society of Great Britain for matched funds with Liverpool Hope for the studentship totalling £30,000. Liverpool Hope has agreed to waive Dr Helyer’s full-time fees. The studentship was advertised on jobs.ac.uk, and Dr Helyer won out over 11 applications. Dr Helyer’s previous PhD was in Creative Writing and American Literature and she has built a career as an English teacher.

The Pedagogies of Punishment project assembles an international, interdisciplinary team of collaborators with diverse identities to identify and advocate for more just responses to student wrongdoing. Funding ($39,967) was previously provided to Drs Tillson and Thompson by the Centre for Ethics and Education and details of publications arising from the research can be found on the project website: https://www.pedagogiesofpunishment.com/. This PhD studentship builds on the Pedagogies of Punishment project by enabling a student to draw on philosophical and psychological frameworks to cast new light on the morality of school disciplinary policies and practices.

In her presentation, Laura identified a family of tightly connected, under-explored and ethically interesting questions about whether and how teachers should enforce zero-tolerance codes of conduct they do not accept. She gave a clear and compelling proposal, identifying relevant philosophical rights-based frameworks and psychological frameworks and gave strong indications as to how they could be used to resolve the questions she identified.

We are very much looking forward to welcoming her to our research team.
